questions.text: Director Steven Soderbergh was not allowed to use any government officials during the cocktail party sequence in Washington, D.C.
questions.explanation:
False.

	There were U.S. Senators, Congressman and Congresswomen, and several well-known journalists in attendance, among other notables appearing as themselves. The extras portraying themselves included: Harry Ried, Jeff Podolsky, Barbara Boxer, Orrin G. Hatch, and Charles Grassley. During the scene, Michael Douglas was followed by a camera and while in character, asked them questions and got their feelings regarding the drug war, what the specific problems were in their states, and so on.
